io.fluo.api.client

Interface SnapshotBase

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Snapshot, Transaction, TransactionBase
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TypedSnapshot, TypedSnapshotBase, TypedTransaction, TypedTransactionBase

    public interface SnapshotBase
    Allows users to read from a Fluo table at a certain point in time

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Bytes get(Bytes row, Column column)
      Retrieves the value (in Bytes) stored at a given row and Column.
      Map<Column,Bytes> get(Bytes row, Set<Column> columns)
      Given a row and set of Columns, retrieves a map contains the values at those Columns.
      Map<Bytes,Map<Column,Bytes>> get(Collection<Bytes> rows, Set<Column> columns)
      Given a collection of rows and set of Columns, retrieves a map contains the values at those rows and Columns.
      RowIterator get(ScannerConfiguration config)
      Retrieves a RowIterator with the given ScannerConfiguration
      long getStartTimestamp() 

    • Method Detail

      • get

        Bytes get(Bytes row,
          Column column)
        Retrieves the value (in Bytes) stored at a given row and Column. Returns null if does not exist.

      • get

        Map<Column,Bytes> get(Bytes row,
                      Set<Column> columns)
        Given a row and set of Columns, retrieves a map contains the values at those Columns. Only columns that exist will be returned in map.

      • get

        Map<Bytes,Map<Column,Bytes>> get(Collection<Bytes> rows,
                                 Set<Column> columns)
        Given a collection of rows and set of Columns, retrieves a map contains the values at those rows and Columns. Only rows and columns that exists will be returned in map.

      • get

        RowIterator get(ScannerConfiguration config)
        Retrieves a RowIterator with the given ScannerConfiguration

      • getStartTimestamp

        long getStartTimestamp()
        Returns:
        transactions start timestamp allocated from Oracle.
